titleInfo.title: Glimpses of Nashville, Tennessee: A bit of the Vanderbilt University

mods.identifier: Glimpses of Nashville Book049 A bit of the Vanderbilt University in 1904

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A view of Vanderbilt Universityâ€™s Kirkland Hall, with the statue of Commodore Cornelius Vanderbilt in front, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1904. The university is named for shipping and rail tycoon "Commodore" Cornelius Vanderbilt. He was 79 years old when he decided to donate a one million dollar endowment gift that founded Vanderbilt University in the spring of 1873. Commodore Cornelius Vanderbilt had a vision of a university that would "contribute to strengthening the ties that should exist between all sections of our common country." Forms part of Glimpses of Nashville. 1 booklet
